info.title: Get Satisfaction API
info.description: Articles that matter on social publishing platform

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The id of the company being queried

parameters.name: active_since
parameters.description: Filter by the time of the last activity in the community. Time is set in seconds since epoch.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Filter by product name in API queries where the company is specified (for example, /companies/[company name or company ID]/topics)

200.description: a list of topic objects within a data envelope.

active_replies.description: The number of replies (but not comments) that are associated with the topic and have not been archived or deleted.

author.description: Returns the following data block for the author of the post (see the people object for more information)

at_sfn.description: The URL path to the user’s profile page

avatar.description: The URL path to the full size image the user uploaded for their avatar

avatar_url_large.description: The URL path to large sized avatar image

avatar_url_medium.description: The URL path to medium sized avatar image

avatar_url_mini.description: The URL path to a mini sized avatar image

avatar_url_small.description: The URL path to small sized avatar image

canonical_name.description: The slug for the user’s Get Satisfaction profile (/profile/[canonical name])

champion.description: Whether the user is a champion. Returns “true” or “false”

employee.description: Whether the user is an employee. Returns “true” or “false”

member_since.description: The date and time when the user joined

name.description: The nickname of the user (not the “canonical name”)

url.description: The API path to the user’s information

champion.description: Whether the topic was created by a champion or not. Returns “true” or “false”.

closed_at.description: A timestamp of when the topic was closed. This property only exists if “is_closed” is True.

company_id.description: The id for the company in Get Satisfaction

created_at.description: The date and time topic was created

face.description: The emoticon face. Values are “happy”, “silly”, “indifferent”, and “sad”

feeling.description: The text associated with the emoticon face.

intensity.description: The intensity of the emoticon on a scale of 0 to 4. 0 – hides the emoticon, 1 – shows the emoticon, 2 – shows the emoticon with one exclamation mark, 3 – shows the emoticon with two exclamation marks, 4 – shows the emoticon with two exclamation marks

employee.description: Whether the topic was created by an employee or not. Returns “true” or “false”.

follower_count.description: The number of people following the topic

following.description: Whether the topic is being followed by the user who is authenticating the API call. Returns “true” or “false”

has_promoted_replies.description: Whether the topic has any replies promoted, either through stars or as a company answer. Returns “true” or “false”

is_archived.description: Whether the post has been archived. Returns “true” or “false”

is_closed.description: Boolean to show if the topic has been closed. True if closed, False if not closed.

is_spam.description: Whether the post has been classified as spam. Returns “true” or “false”

is_removed.description: Whether the post has been removed. Returns “true” or “false”

last_active_at.description: The date and time of last topic activity

me_too.description: The URL slug for the particular topic

me_too_count.description: The count of people who have clicked the +1 button (including the original poster)

most_recent_activity.description: The most recent action taken on the topic. Values are “create”, “comment”, and “follow”.

reply_count.description: The number of replies and comments for this topic

slug.description: The URL slug for the particular topic

status.description: The topic status. Values are null, pending, active, complete, rejected

style.description: The type of topic. The possible values are “question”, “problem”, “praise”, “idea”, and “update”.

subject.description: The subject line for the topic

url.description: The API endpoint that returns the topic object

user_defined_codes.description: The private tag if there is one. If there isn’t one, it returns “false”

data.description: a list of topic objects within a data envelope

parameters.name: active_since
parameters.description: Filter by the time of the last activity in the community. Time is set in seconds since epoch.

data.description: a list of topic objects within a data envelope

parameters.name: topicIdOrSlug
parameters.description: The topicId or topic slug for the topic being queried

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Return all company and star promoted replies

parameters.name: include_comments
parameters.description: Exclude comments from the returned replies

200.description: List of topic reply objects within a data envelope.

at_sfn.description: The URL path to the user’s profile page

avatar.description: The URL path to the full size image the user uploaded for their avatar

avatar_url_large.description: The URL path to large sized avatar image

avatar_url_medium.description: The URL path to medium sized avatar image

avatar_url_mini.description: The URL path to a mini sized avatar image

champion.description: Whether the user is a champion. Returns “true” or “false”

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The userId being queried for replies

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Return all company and star promoted replies

parameters.name: include_comments
parameters.description: Exclude comments from the returned replies
